intro: Cordia micronesica, commonly known as the Micronesian cordia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Guam. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Cordia micronesica is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
